statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.headline: Campbell 94, N.C.-Asheville 57
article.story: BUIES CREEK, N.C. -- Jonathan Rodriguez scored 19 points to help Campbell rout North Carolina-Asheville 94-57 on Saturday. The 37-point victory margin was Campbell's largest against a Division I opponent since Feb. 6, 1989, when the Camels (2-1) defeated Augusta 99-62. Campbell converted 20 North Carolina-Asheville turnovers into 29 points. The Camels led 42-28 at halftime, then increased the gap with an 18-2 run. Lorne Merthie and Amir Celestin had season highs in scoring with 14 points apiece for the Camels. William Kossangue chipped in with 10. The Bulldogs (3-1), who were trying to get off to a 4-0 start for the second straight year, were stymied by Campbell's 11 of 24 3-pointers and 38-21 advantage on the boards. Sean Smith led the North Carolina-Asheville with 13 points.
